journalismmediastudies.name: JOURNALISM & MEDIA STUDIES
journalismmediastudies.content: In this 30 day workshop, experience the life of a journalist. Learn how to film a documentary, write like a journalist, create an advertisement, and make a career in the field of media!
whattolearn: Introduction to Media Studies and Journalism.
Explore the potential of Travel, Sports and Citizen Journalism
Careers prospects and opportunities in journalism

course.name: Understanding the real meaning of Journalism: An Overview
content: What is journalism
Media: And introduction

course.name: Ad Campaigns, Newsrooms and the Influence of Media on the World
content: Can journalism be yellow
Kinds of journalism in the digital age : Sports, Travel, Investigative etc.

course.name: Analyzing Media and the free speech debate
content: Citizen Journalism and Social Media
How does the Media control the world?
Media and money

course.name: Learning about news stories and how to get them right
content: Making an ad campaign : An Introduction
Upholding the Fourth Pillar of Democracy
Analysing the media!
The Final Chapter - Writing a News Story

captains.name: SHANTAM SAHAI
captains.content: Shantam is a  Media and Communication student. Having worked with several media houses- PinkCityPost, NewsGram, and Zee Media he knows exactly what young writers need to work as journalists. He has also worked with Ms. Medha Patkar and NAPM for Narmada Bachao Andolan, and also with the Aam Aadmi Party for Policy Research. His major interest in research is “Constructed Reality”

captains.name: AARUSHI NAYYAR
captains.content: Aarushi Nayyar has studied Journalism and Mass Communication from Kamala Nehru College, Delhi University. She has interned at various media houses including the Times of India and The Hindu. Having worked as a freelance writer in different capacities for 3 years, she is excited to share her love for writing and passion for journalism with all her mentees. At present, she works as a copywriter at Leo Burnett, Delhi.

feed.name: Labeeb Ajmal , Creative Writing Workshop
feed.content: The Creative Writing Workshop conducted by MyCaptain was a great one to hone my writing skills. It gave me insight on how to structure my poetry and make it more presentable. The Captain was amazing and a fun relationship was share on and off the workshop. This is a great way to learn more about one's passion with tutors/mentors who strike a chord with those who join the workshops.

feed.name: Madhura Sonegaonkar , Creative Writing Workshop
feed.content: My experience with my captain was extraordinary. The mentor was very helpful and interactive. My writing improved very much due to the workshop and I went from last page scribbling to being a published poet for platforms like ttt (terribly tiny tales) and other platforms Special shout out to my mentor who still helps me every time I call him.

creativewriting.name: CREATIVE WRITING
creativewriting.content: Improve upon your writing skills across 6 genres of writing. Work on story-writing, understand how novels and novellas are written and polish your Poetry and Prose in this 30 day Online program!
whattolearn: Explore the poetry and lyrics in songs
Writing for plays, scripts and screenplays

course.name: Discover the Poet in you
content: Introduction: The landscape of poetry today, and how you can contribute to it
The importance of the written word in the various cultures of poetry
Why you should write that novel, and 5 tips for when you do
Storytelling I: How to start your story

course.name: Micro Fiction : Less is more
content: Conquering the free verse
Novellas, and the art of the in-between
A peak into the roots of poetry
The poetry in songs

course.name: Storytelling and Blogging
content: What is your genre?
Storytelling III: The Three Minute Story Project
What we can learn from classical women poets
Storytelling IV: For plays, scripts and screenplays

course.name: Publishing 101 and some fun!
content: Writing in the Vernacular
More Tips for writing your Novel, and what to do when you lose your breath
Storytelling V: How to end your story

captains.name: PRAGYA ALAGH
captains.content: Pragya Alagh is a Wall of Fame mentee from the MyCaptain Creative writing Workshop, 2015.  In 2016, she started working at Terribly Tiny Tales as a select writer and regular contributor for their social media platforms. In her free time, she likes to attend literary events around her city, Delhi and also organise some. She loves to quote robert frost and Sylvia Plath when she’s losing arguments. Pragya has mentored over 150 students so far.

captains.name: MADHURA BANERJEE
captains.content: Madhura is a published poet and her first book “A tenant of the World” was released in 2017. She has been invited to scores of literary events and festivals as a guest, speaker and facilitator. Apart from delivering poetry recitals on All India Radio, Madhura is also frequents colleges like St. Xavier’s, NITs as a motivational speaker. She has mentored over 200 enthusiasts in Creative writing so far. Many of her mentees have gone on to publish their short stories and poetry in magazines and elsewhere.

captains.name: MADHURA SONEGAONKAR
captains.content: Madhura Sonegaonkar is a Wall of fame mentee from the MyCaptain Creative Writing Workshop, July, 2017. She is now a professional spoken word poet, a terribly Tiny Tales select writer, and also records her poetry for radio and youtube. Madhura is working on her book right now which is scheduled to get published in 2019. You can spot her as a performer, judge, speaker or facilitator at most of the literary circuit events and fests in the Maharashtra region.

feed.name: Labeeb Ajmal , Creative Writing Workshop
feed.content: The Creative Writing Workshop conducted by MyCaptain was a great one to hone my writing skills. It gave me insight on how to structure my poetry and make it more presentable. The Captain was amazing and a fun relationship was share on and off the workshop. This is a great way to learn more about one's passion with tutors/mentors who strike a chord with those who join the workshops.

feed.name: Madhura Sonegaonkar , Creative Writing Workshop
feed.content: My experience with my captain was extraordinary. The mentor was very helpful and interactive. My writing improved very much due to the workshop and I went from last page scribbling to being a published poet for platforms like ttt (terribly tiny tales) and other platforms Special shout out to my mentor who still helps me every time I call him.

psychology.name: PSYCHOLOGY
psychology.content: Unlock the secrets of how people behave, by understanding psychoanalysis, research,  psychological testing and Mental disorders. Get introduced to Counselling and other careers in Psychology in this 30 day program
whattolearn: Where is Psychology used in daily life?

course.name: History and Schools of Psychology
content: Historical Timeline – Psychology through the ages
Psychoanalysis and Behaviourism
Cognitive and Humanistic Perspectives

course.name: Ethics, Research and Understanding yourself
content: The Importance of Ethics in Psychology
Basic introduction to Research and Psychological Testing
Understanding Oneself
Identity vs. Self-Concept

course.name: A look into abnormal Psychology
content: Introduction to Abnormal Psychology
Using Diagnostic Manuals - DSM & ICD
The Categories of Mental Disorders
Anxiety and Mood Disorders
What exactly is Schizophrenia?

course.name: Counselling and Therapy
content: Introduction to Counselling Psychology
Understanding the difference between counselling and psychotherapy
Counselling skills and Schools of Psychotherapy
Careers in the field of Psychology

captains.name: ANNETTE SHAJU
captains.content: Annette is a postgraduate of Psychology with a special interest in the areas of Clinical and Counselling Psychology. Currently she works as a Psychological Trainer and research assistant at Muktha Foundation, Bangalore. As part of the NGO she trains individuals especially on Prevention of Child sex abuse and Suicide. She has mentored close to 300 students in Psychology many of whom are pursuing psychology full time today.

captains.name: DURGA MENON
captains.content: Durga is a Psychology honours holder and among other things has worked as a research assistant with Mind Matters clinic where she worked on Hypnosis. She also has one published research paper under her belt. Durga has been pursuing psychology for the past 8 years and believes that her true passion lies in Sports Psychology. She has mentored close to 400 students with MyCaptain so far and has empowered many to discover their passion for psychology.

captains.name: DHANYA PILLAI
captains.content: Dhnaya is a post-graduate in Clinical Psychology and is a research Psychologist. Her journey with psychology had begun as a mere interest but with time it transformed into a true passion. She instills the same in her mentees. Dhanya works as a Counsellor with the Organisation, Workplace Options.

captains.name: SHIPRA TIWARI
captains.content: Shipra is a Psychology Honours student from CIC, Delhi. She has been passionate about Psychology since childhood and has helped others understand the importance of Child sexual abuse awareness. She also works on analyzing employment opportunities for people with mental health disorders, especially those with Autism.

captains.name: PRERNA DHINGRA
captains.content: Prerna has worked as a Junior Special Educator at Wisdom Kidz and has a research paper on “The importance of mental health amongst commercial trainee pilots”. She is currently shadowing a Junior Therapist at Mind Solace in New Delhi. Prerna recently launched a Youtube channel by the name “Prerna Dhingra” to help combat emotional issues by giving the psychological perspective & slowly breaking the stigmatisation around the idea of psychotherapy. She has been instilling her mentees with the same with an unparalleled passion.

feed.name: Aishwarya Gangadharan, Psychology Workshop
feed.content: In spite of having a background in finance, I was always interested in learning about psychology and the human mind. My Captain is a platform that is easily accessible when you are putting in so much effort looking for distance learning courses, and at a very affordable fees. I found my mentor really approachable and knowledgeable about the subject and all the lessons were equipped with videos that helped me better understand the concepts. It also, however, didn't take up a too many hours per day. I appreciate this brilliant initiative MyCaptain. Totally worth it!

feed.name: Ekta, Psychology Workshop
feed.content: I had taken up the psychology course and I was very impressed with the efforts taken up by my Captain also the course was very easily accessible and user friendly and finally the feature which I loved the most was the convince to learn at whatever time I wanted to the tasks given and discussion s taken place were very interesting and kept me glued to the topic. At the end of it I was just satisfied by the topics thought in an easy and understandable way

graphicdesign.name: GRAPHIC DESIGN
graphicdesign.content: In this 30 day Program understand the science behind choosing colours and designing logos! Learn to use Photoshop and Illustrator and make an entry into the World of Graphic design.
whattolearn: Start with the basics of Design

course.name: Planning your design
content: What is Graphic Design
Understanding Colour
Understanding Typography

course.name: The most important concepts in Design
content: What are Elements of Design?
Introduction to Photoshop
Introduction to Illustrator

course.name: The Design process
content: What are Principles of Design
Understanding Composition

course.name: Execution and Feedback
content: Drafting a design brief
Understanding the Design Process

captains.name: FATEMA HUSSAIN
captains.content: I'm a designpreneur whose guiding principle in design is to bring social change. In my quest for helping people understand Design and its future I have mentored more than 150 students so far, and while some of them have gotten into Design school, others are actively working in the field!

captains.name: SUKANTA PAUL
captains.content: A User Experience Designer by profession, I'm currently working with Accenture Digital. An automobile enthusiast, traveler, illustrator, I have worked on a wide variety of projects ranging from designing a vernacular display font to developing a complex healthcare application. I have worked with Companies Like Ogilvy & Mather, Vodafone and has won a couple of awards and accolades. I believe the greatest instrument in learning the craft of design is through trial and error.

captains.name: SHEETAL SHANKAR
captains.content: I am a New Age Experience Designer at Accenture. For the last 2 years, I have lead design teams to create digital and physical experiences for products dealing with next-gen tech like Artificial Intelligence and Virtual Reality. I work on planning the design strategy and creating UX deliverables for various products and services. I have won multiple Awards in my organisation for exemplary design and delivery.

feed.name: Nitesh Reddy, Graphic Design Workshop
feed.content: MyCaptain Graphic Design Workshop is one of the best courses I have ever done. The content in the Workshop is very well curated and on to the point. The discussions we have with our mentors is very helpful not only in gaining knowledge but also to clarify every doubt you ever have regarding the course. I was a Mechanical Engineering student and now I’m pursuing Graphic Design full time, thanks to my mentor Fatema!

feed.name: Rishik Jhunjhunwala, Graphic Design Workshop
feed.content: The Graphic Designing workshop was an amazing experience, it has allowed to me take a step in the direction of my passion. With a great Workshop outline, and amazingly fun tasks spread out in the middle, the workshop truly allowed me to understand the intricacies of design. Kudos to MyCaptain team and our Captain, Fatema!

photography.name: PHOTOGRAPHY
photography.content: A comprehensive guide to creating breath taking compositions and fulfil the hidden Shutter-bug in you. Take the 30 day experience with us!
whattolearn: How to freelance and getting gigs
Composition and framing of your pictures
How to brand yourself as a photographer

course.name: A first look into photography
content: An introduction to photography
Deciding colours and frame of our subjects
Back to medieval times’ pictures
Playing around with the DSLR and getting to know your love
Spilling around some light

course.name: Camera settings, post processing and Careers in the field
content: A portal to the tiny world
Freezing the world around?
Let’s do some editing
Full control over your gear
Wonder liquid captured

course.name: Pro Tips and Social media presence
content: Fast forwarding the world
Late night wandering
Getting employed
A quick glance at all the fun
Lens filters explained

course.name: Final Touches
content: Capturing mist, the slow world
Panning, the art of motion photography
In the neighbourhood
Reverse lens macro
Magic lantern

captains.name: VIJAY RAMANATHAN
captains.content: I love photographing, traveling, film making and physics. I have got many International and National mentions in photography. I have been an active member of National Geographic’s Your Shot Community. My works have got featured and published under Better Photography Magazine. What I enjoy the most is to combine travel videos and music with a perfect sync in each and every beat. I’m a great motivator and I can understand people thoroughly. I love making new friends and meeting new people from different cultures and perspectives. I am Vijay Ramanathan, I am an Instrumentation Service Engineer and I freelance photography as well. I shoot photographs of all genres. Nature, Travel, and Wildlife to be specific! ;) Get ready to be amazed! Come with me, let me show you a different world!

captains.name: DEEPAK SONI
captains.content: I am a 25-year old self taught Photographer and a drop out. I started Photography as a hobby during my engineering and within one year of that term, this hobby turned out to be my long lasting passion and career. Working for different people on diffrent projects is my way of traveling and that's what I love the most. I always charged low prices initially, but never did anything for free.

captains.name: PRACHEE ARYA
captains.content: I started my Photography career with an Amateurs passion and headed Photography clubs at my college. In my workshop, I will mentor you in all the skills I have acquired the hard way. I have mentored more than 150 students in the MyCaptain program so far, some of whom have gone ahead to become very good photographers.

feed.name: Roshan Topno , Photography Workshop
feed.content: I started my photography as an Amateur passion and joined my college photography club. In my workshop I got to learn a lot of new concept and the discussion session with cap are the best. Till today Mohsin, my captain is helping me in improving my skills. My experience with My Captain has given a blast to my photography skills. This experience with My Captain was so good that it forced me to do another workshop. It has turned out to be a deciding factor.

feed.name: Teenu, Photography Workshop
feed.content: I'm happy with the MyCaptain workshop on Photography. It's something even a person without a DSLR camera could do. The transformation from mobile photography to DSLR camera photography is not that easy. I'm ready very happy that my Captain (Mohsin) was always available for any help. The workshop is well organised, with a proper schedule. I found the WhatsApp group associated with the workshop too very useful

modelunitednations.name: MODEL UNITED NATIONS
modelunitednations.content: Find out how the United Nations works and how to be a part of it. Take part in this 30 day Model United Nations workshop and learn more.
whattolearn: Exploring the different bodies of the UN
Decoding the mandates of different committees

course.name: The UN and the MUN
content: What is United Nations
What is Model United Nations
Examining the United Nations Charter

course.name: Digging Deeper into MUNs
content: What are the different bodies of the UN
Mandates of different committees (non specialised)
Let’s do some editing
Mandates of different committees (specialised)

course.name: Strategies for your MUN
content: What research strategies to follow?
RoP (General Committees)
RoP (Specialised Committees)

course.name: Paperwork, Practice and inside information
content: Paperwork for General Committees
Paperwork for Specialised Committees
pro-Tips for your Model United Nations

captains.name: SABIQ CHAUDHARY
captains.content: I am a graduate from SRM University, Chennai. I've done over 40 MUNs in the capacity of being an Executive Member, delegate and Member of the OC. My specialisation lies in Disarmament and Military based committees and I also have a special inclination towards Crisis committees wherein I love to topple governments, start wars and basically like to end conflicts by starting new ones! ;) Besides MUNs, I am a metal music fanatic which might be surprising for you considering my appearance of a peaceful Sufi singer. If you are coming to my committee, expect subtle, clever responses to no matter what you throw at me. All the best!

captains.name: PRAGYA ALAGH
captains.content: My first encounter with debating was in 10th grade when the first session for MUNs was held in our school. Since then, there has been no looking back. I have been involved in MUNs throughout my school life as the President of the MUN Society but that's not where my association with debating ends. So far, I've participated in about 100 MUNs, conventional and parliamentary debates (and won some) and currently work as the head co-ordinator for the debating society at my Indraprastha College for Women. I'm really passionate about debating and public speaking primarily because it gives me a chance to gain perspective on issues as well as to have a platform to be heard.

spokenwordpoetry.name: SPOKEN WORD POETRY
spokenwordpoetry.content: In this 30 Day Online Workshop Conducted by Airplane Poetry Movement, learn the tricks of Spoken Word Poetry, write and perform better. Also learn how to Market your content Online!
whattolearn: How to gain and retain a captive audience for your poetry
Charting out your long-term roadmaps for poetic success!
Basic & advanced techniques to a good performance

course.name: The writing process
content: Intro to spoken word poetry, and how it's different from page poetry
The Art of Writing: How to use poetic techniques and devices in your poems.

course.name: Understanding Rhyme, rhythm and how to edit your poems
content: The Art Of Editing: Methods & techniques to edit your poems
How To Perform Like A Pro: Basic & advanced rules to perform to the best of your ability

course.name: Performing your poetry
content: How To Record & Publish Your Poems
Feedback Session: We give you personalised feedback on your poems

course.name: Marketing and publishing your Poetry
content: How to gain and retain a captive audience for your poetry
Conclusion To The Workshop: Charting out your long-term roadmaps for success!

captains.name: SHANTANU ANAND
captains.content: I am the co-founder of Airplane Poetry Movement. My job is to help poets reach the top of their potential, and create spoken word poems that they're truly proud of! I've performed poetry at events like TEDxBangalore, Times Lit Fest Delhi and Spoken Fest, Mumbai. I have been published in magazines like Muse India and The Bombay Review. In the last 4 years, I've conducted over 75 workshops across the country, for a cumulative total of over 1500 people.

captains.name: NANDINI TRIVEDI
captains.content: I am the co-founder of Airplane Poetry Movement. We organised the first National Youth Poetry Slam in India, and got poets like Sarah Kay and Phil Kaye to India. I have performed poetry at events like TEDxBangalore, Times Lit Fest Delhi and Spoken Fest, Mumbai and shared stage with the likes of Sarah Kay and Phil Kaye. I have been published in magazines like Muse India and The Bombay Review. In the last 4 years, I have conducted over 75 workshops across the country, for a cumulative total of over 1500 people.

bloggingandcontentwriting.name: BLOGGING AND CONTENT WRITING
bloggingandcontentwriting.content: Learn the basics of building a blog and selecting your genre successfully. Help garnish your writing style and learn how to publicise your blog in this 30 Day Online Workshop!
whattolearn: A beginner's guide to setting up blogs
Developing a Network and relationships in the Blogging Community

course.name: Getting started
content: What is a blog?
Is Blogging the right fit for you?
A beginner's guide to setting up blogs

course.name: Planning it all out

Developing relationships in a blogging community
Handling feedback and negativity on writing

course.name: Discovering the Blogging Community
content: Can blogs lead you to bigger and better things?
Blog and Content Promotion
Monetising your Passion Project

captains.name: ARCHANA SURESH
captains.content: I am a Finance Graduate by profession and currently working as an Analyst at a Private Equity Firm, and write for my passion project, TheCulinaryColloquy in my free time. Amassing thousands of views in my last year spanning from 39 countries spanning 6 continents, my blog has not only been a constant source of joy for me but also a humble reminder of just how interconnected this community has become today. I hope share my journey so far through this workshop and benefit you guys.

captains.name: RACHNA CHAWLA
captains.content: I am the founder of Scripto. , which started out as a content writing startup in Jan'17, but since then we have also ventured in domains like designing and SEO. Prior to Scripto, I have worked with various brands as a freelancer, to help them curate content strategies. In addition to this, I have been a part of learning programs carried out by Discovery Channel Asia, TISS (Mumbai) etc. This has helped me unlock new tricks and trends to begin with a Content Strategy. I hope I am able to share all my experiences with you guys and help you take the first step in this field.

captains.name: SOHAM BASAK
captains.content: I'm a medical student by profession and a blogger, graphic designer and video editor by passion! I have been enthusiastic about blogging, Creative Writing and Photography since High School when I started out with Freelancing. I'm now working for a Content writing Company called Scripto. I have completed over 80 Commercial projects so far. I believe in giving back to the community!

captains.name: KEVIN SHADARACH
captains.content: I started off with translating two of my poems into films, of which the latter got to participate in National and International film festivals and bagged a handful of nominations, awards and laurels. Along with that, I also run a small time creative business house called 'Kunst Von Drach' roofing customised fine art services, a media production house and a performing platform. Writing screenplays is a hobby, a passion as well as a profession. I have also penned lyrics for an English song in a 2011 Tamil feature film at the age of 12.

captains.name: SHIVENDRA SINGH
captains.content: I am the Co Founder and Chief Technology Officer of Droid Sector, a Tech Startup. I've led teams in various android development projects and have mentored close to 100 students in the same. I am passionate about empowering young India with technology like never before.

captains.name: NINAD MOHITE
captains.content: I have been an enthusiastic Android developer for a couple of years now. I have developed many apps, one of them has around 40k downloads on the PlayStore. I have also mentored my juniors in the college through the Google Developers Student Club (DSC) program. This is a great opportunity for me to share my experience and skills and empower students who are at the same stage as I once was!

captains.name: ABHIPRAE CHOUDHARY
captains.content: II am a software engineer in HP Inc. I have been working in Android Development for past 4 years, and during these 4 years I have completed over 15 projects for various clients. I like working on Android so I keep working on some or the other project that helps me learn and explore more and more about it. I love teaching and mentoring others on what I know by now!

captains.name: AKSHAY GUPTA
captains.content: I am a Software Engineer by Profession and a coder by choice. I am into mobile application development from the past 3 years and have developed some of the apps for my clients as well. I have mentored more than 300 students in this field and love doing so. I feel mentoring is the best way to both share and gain knowledge.

captains.name: PRASHANTH
captains.content: I started my journey as an android developer by doing a MyCaptain Online Workshop. I have worked on two projects as an Android Developer and I have extensively worked with location APIs. I am passionate about creating Innovative and Flexible apps that make our lives simpler. This is a very good opportunity for me to open up about my insights, share my experiences, skills in Android and also to continue the learning process with you. I keep working on several projects and apps so as to learn all flavours of Android Development

feed.name: Anurag, Web Development Workshop
feed.content: The Web development workshop was a nice one. I really liked the concept of live teaching. It would be even better if it were for little longer period of time because one month was quite a short time to learn most of the web development or to at least reach an intermediate level of programming which I was expecting. But for just the basics of web development, it was a great course

feed.name: Pratishtha, Web Development Workshop
feed.content: I'm currently pursuing my BBA at Symbiosis, Pune. Today when almost the entire world is going digital, I feel learning basic coding is a really beneficial skill. Moreover, I am into marketing in the digital space and would like to be able to make my own website, if ever required. I did a web development course from MyCaptain and I think it was absolutely worth my time and effort. I recommend MyCaptain to everyone out there who is looking forward to learning new skills at their own convenience.

artificialintelligence.name: ARTIFICIAL INTELLIGENCE
artificialintelligence.content: This comprehensive 30 day workshop will train you in the basics of Python, Natural Language Processing, Sentiment Analysis and Data evaluation to prepare you for the latest jobs in AI.
whattolearn: Decision making, Functions, Classes and Objects in Python
Writing and Testing your First ML Algorithm
Understanding the role of Python in Data Science
Introduction to NLP, Sentiment Analysis and Deep Learning
Introduction to Machine Learning - A practical approach

How does facial recognition work
Careers, Opportunities and Networking

captains.name: SHAIL SHAH
captains.content: I am a Computer Science Engineer by profession and used to work at Tata Consultancy before, where I created 2 Artificial Intelligence bots which are being used by two International Airlines right now. I have worked on query based text summarisers as well, among others. I have a keen interest in AI research and have published papers on the same.

captains.name: NINAD MOHITE
captains.content: I have been an enthusiastic Android developer for a couple of years now. I have developed many apps, one of them has around 40k downloads on the PlayStore. I have also mentored my juniors in the college through the Google Developers Student Club (DSC) program. This is a great opportunity for me to share my experience and skills and empower students who are at the same stage as I once was!

captains.name: YUVRAJ JESWAL
captains.content: I am Yuvraj and I work with VMware as an application developer since Jan 2017 after graduating from BIT Mesra, Ranchi. I am a big fan of learning new things, building cool things and using tech for good. I love mentoring people and being a captain for MyCaptain is an exciting thing I am looking forward to. Apart from this, I enjoy sports, quizzing and literature as well! So bring it all on!

feed.name: Aaditi Verma, Artificial Intelligence Workshop
feed.content: I had an amazing experience with cooperative peeps, understanding mentor or as we call him Captain! He not only provided solutions to our various problems be it as stupid and simple but also gave reasons behind each and every command he taught! He was always there to help us. He even encouraged & guided everyone in the batch to always keep trying. In all, i had a great & fun-filled experience.

feed.name: Anish Poddar, Artificial Intelligence Workshop
feed.content: The MyCaptain course was an insightful and practical introduction to the world of AI, Machine Learning and Language Processing, interweaving live chat sessions with small but educational assignments to test out our skills. The course content was complete and holistic, providing the framework for a structured but fun introduction to the topic. Sessions were engaging, compact and interspersed with practical examples. Our Mentor was smart, patient and helpful throughout the course, and queries were solved very satisfactorily. Moreover, I liked that the course was open-ended in the sense that it allowed its takers to go above and beyond the course material to explore the subject and its implementation in further depth. I definitely took a lot away from this course, and recommend it to others without the slightest hesitation.

webdevelopment.name: WEB DEVELOPMENT
webdevelopment.content: Learn the basics of HTML5, CSS3 and Bootstrap, PHP and Javascript to build your first Website from scratch in this 30 day Online Workshop!
whattolearn: Learn about the latest Design Trends
Basic Hacks for keeping Users safe
Develop the skeleton of your Website using HTML
Build a form for your website
Use Bootstrap to Design your Website
Career prospects, freelancing and other opportunities for Developers

The DNA of every website - HTML5
Creating wireframes - Do's and Dont's

course.name: Designing your Website with bootstrap

The Internet's fashion guide - Bootstrap
Adding functionality to the website - PHP

Being a Web Developer - Career Aspects
Web Dev - Things worth knowing

course.name: Your future as a Web Developer
content: Testing the website - User Experience
Putting the website online - Taking things online
The journey of a Web Developer
Freelancing Opportunities as Web Developer

captains.name: AQUIB AJANI
captains.content: I'm a software engineer by profession and have been training students in Programming for the past 6 years now. I have trained over 600 students in various different Programming languages and frameworks so far and I realise one thing- Engineering students in India need to have a deeper understanding of things. I want to change this. I'm also the formal trainer with the MyCaptain Coders Pack.

captains.name: ADITYA PUDIPEDDI
captains.content: Being an introvert is tough, you have to make up for all the energy you save by not interacting with people doing something else. I have utilised this energy in satisfying my curiosity. I work as a Web-developer to make ideas eternal and ever accessible to everyone through a single medium. In my two years of experience with web, I have made nearly 30 portals that are tailor-made for various functionalities like theme-selection, registration, certification and so on. With the challenge of new languages and better frameworks. I move forward teaching what I've learnt as best as I can and learning greater things to continue the cycle.

captains.name: ANURAG
captains.content: I started by making software for my own college and later selling it to other colleges. The adventure continued when I joined a startup to learn the industry way of shipping a product. Some of the interesting  things that I have worked on in the past are for example the BHIM UPI app by out honourable Prime Minister Narendra Modi launched in less than a month during demonetisation. I was part of a two-member team who coded the Gozoomo bikes application in less than a week. Added some product features which increased the conversion rate by 10-20%. I have also shipped a serverless web app for Gozoomo bikes marketing site which decreased the CPC from Rs.350 to Rs.50, also conversions increased conversions by 25%. The VTU results site was always slow during results, hence I deployed a WhatsApp bot which would fetch the results from VTU and send via WhatsApp. The bot saw a growth of more than 500 users in less than 3 days. The bot would give a feeling that someone was typing the results before sending which would give an impression to the end user that it was not a bot. It is going to be an adventure mentoring young minds now!

captains.name: HARSHITH MULLAPUDI
captains.content: I'm Harshith Mullapudi. I'm 1 part fun-loving, 3 parts developer, 2 parts adventurous gypsy and a happy person all the way. I am basically Frankenstein who loves his weird creations. I am constantly developing different applications. I am a problem solver and always want to learn something new and exciting. When I'm not developing, I explore the city and sometimes take impromptu trips to have a change of scenery. You'll find me glued to my laptop, or trekking my way through mountains

captains.content: I have studied automobile engineering from JNTU, Hyderabad. I have co-founded a car maintenance venture Carjoz. I am actively involved in motorsports events under Mean Metal Motors. I am also the fan-site operator of FIA Formula E India fan-site. I will be sharing my love and passion for cars in this workshop with you all.

captains.name: ROHIT SEN
captains.content: I am a second year B. Tech student in Electronics and Communication Department of SRM Institute of Science and Technology. I am working as an Electronics Engineer in the Formula Students Electric Team at SRM IST. I have also worked on Autonomous Underwater Vehicles. I have also worked on some electronics and IOT related projects.

feed.name: Shobhit, Ethical Hacking Workshop
feed.content: To catch a thief, think like one. To thwart a hacker, become one. The MyCaptain workshop on ethical hacking introduced the intricacies of computer networks and even how to exploit them. It shed light on the various measures that are taken against the black-hats or the bad hackers. Many links were provided in each lesson for further reading. Best of all, it even introduced us to a community that has computers integrated into their lifestyles.  Also, you can search anything on Google, even passwords.

feed.name: Srinath, Ethical Hacking Workshop
feed.content: The workshop on Ethical Hacking was awesome. I was a bit nervous in the beginning, but later the mentor guided well. The discussion days helped in clarification of my doubts. The Tasks to be performed were like making the hack realistic and getting practical. I liked being a part of workshop.

captains.name: PRANSHU RANKAKOTI
captains.content: Greetings! I am Pranshu Ranakoti, an undergrad student, currently pursuing my B.Tech (CSE) from GD Goenka University. I am an infosec enthusiast, fluent in BASH, OSINT, Recon and Scanning. I am a learner, a thinker and a visionary (that’s what I believe). My motto: To work for the greater good and make this world a better place to live in! Do you have a problem? Does it needs quick and efficient solution? Well you are at the right place!

captains.content: I am an Electronics and Electrical graduate . During the course of my studies, I have done a coveted internship at the Stemsel, Australia and was selected to present my project at the IEEE IAS International Conference twice, in 2016 and 2017. Now being the founder of Unik Innovation, Kochi, I am working on building an exoskeleton for paraplegia patients.

feed.name: Archita Dev, Android App Development Workshop
feed.content: I joined the MyCaptain Android App Development Workshop some months ago. The Content provided is really good and the interactions with the Captain were very beneficial. Overall My Captain is very helpful as there as a variety of Workshops to choose from.

feed.name: Pritesh Lunkad, Android App  Development Workshop
feed.content: The workshop was well organized and was planned out meticulously. With well-equipped online presentations. The concepts were presented vividly with adequate illustrations. The curious self was implored by the discussion session. Our Captain Shiven Singh was fully dedicated in helping us understand the concepts with ease. Kudos to the MyCaptain team !

captains.name: Bhavana Rajagopalan
captains.content: I am Bhavana Rajagopalan. To give you a short introduction, I have studied Mass Media with a specialisation in advertising. I have interned at the coveted ad agency - Ogilvy & Mather, have worked at Metaphors Advertising Inc. in Nagpur and currently am an Account Manager at The Minimalist. I have handled more than 25 accounts for marketing communication until now and am joining Indian School of Business, Hyderabad in April 2019 for my MBA. I look forward to this workshop and am excited to be not just a mentor but also a friend you can turn to.

feed.name: Himanshi Yadav , Advertising & Marketing Workshop
feed.content: I did my workshop on Advertising and marketing, it’s a great start to pursue something of your interest. The sessions were knowledgeable, interesting and inclusive. Special mention to Bhavana ( our captain) who is pretty helpful and goes out of her way to clear your doubts.

feed.name: Jigesh , Advertising & Marketing Workshop
feed.content: Mycaptain workshop was very useful as it helped me to enhance my knowledge on marketing and different advertising techniques. My mentor Bhavana madam, helped me a lot by clarifying all the doubts and always motivated me to look deep into the marketing world. It was a great experience altogether.

financeandstockmarkets.name: FINANCE AND STOCK MARKETS
financeandstockmarkets.content: Your basic guide to understanding how the complicated world of Finance and Stock markets works. You will also start trading with real time stocks in a simulation in this 30 day Online Workshop.
whattolearn: Evolution of money and the Stock Market
Introduction to Financial Ratios and Analysis
Case Study : Decoding the 2008 Stock market crash (The Subprime Crisis)
The Why, What and How ofmInvestments
Practice investing with a Stock Market Simulator

course.name: Birth and Evolution of Money
content: Evolution of money: From Barter to Cryptocurrencies
Evolution of stock markets
Sensex calculation and stock markets

course.name: How to analyse companies?
content: Financial Statements & Ratios
What is an Investment Life Cycle
The Subprime Crisis and important Stock Market terms

course.name: How to choose stocks?
content: How to Pick up stocks
Paper Trading: What, why, and how?
Calculating Returns and Mitigating risks

course.name: Going out into the real world
content: Devising your own Strategies
Career in Finance
Career in Stock Markets

captains.name: PRAHALADH HARIHARAN
captains.content: I am an MSc. in Finance, and have interned with Ministry of Finance, India. I have also been on the National Support Team - Finance, AIESEC in South Africa, apart from being the VP of expansions for AIESEC in Chennai. So far I have mentored over 175 students in Finance and Stock Markets. Join me in my passion!

captains.name: ANUJ AGARWAL
captains.content: I am a CCAP associate at CRISIL Limited. I was a National Semi Finalist at Tata Mutual Fund's Simply Finance Quiz 2014 and winner of Persistent acumen - Business Quiz. I was also a Regional runner up at the Tata Mutual Fund Simply Finance Quiz. I have worked on several Financial Analysis projects including improvement of Financial Management System of Indian Steel Industry. I have also worked on Measurement and Improvement of Service Quality of Banks using 'SERVQUAL'. I hope to share some good knowledge through this workshop!

captains.name: CHHAVI
captains.content: I am an M.Sc. student of Finance, G.I.P.E. I have a bachelor degree in Economics and have worked with the Axis bank as an intern in the foreign exchange department. I regularly invest in stock market and aspire to become an Indian Economics Services Officer and am constantly working towards my goal.

captains.name: DIPESH BAID
captains.content: I am an engineer turned financial analyst. I have completed two levels of CFA and have made several research reports on stocks & sectors for various investment banks, specialising in the Real Estate, Financial Services and Automotive sectors. I also have experience in M&A, with a focus on valuation. I am currently the CFO of a manufacturing company with over INR 90 crores in turnover. Also, I am currently writing three public policy papers - one on how firms use the Bootstrap Effect to artificially inflate their EPS, second on why Indian public policy needs to shift away from agriculture and become a hub for mass manufacturing to reduce unemployment, and third on the applicability of Individual Transferable Quotas and costs of quota leasing on Indian fisheries. Initially, it was hard for me to make the shift from engineering to finance. Through the mentorship program, I hope to make that transition easier for many students!

feed.name: Aaditya, Finance and Stock Markets Workshop
feed.content: MyCaptain is a very nice initiative for Online workshops. I started my workshop in Stock Market and Finance and found it a great help in gaining knowledge about Stock markets especially. Our Captain was brilliant! She explained every topic thoroughly with proper examples. To conclude i am very happy to be a part of Mycaptain community and I am looking forward to new workshops in it.

feed.name: Keshav, Finance and Stock Markets Workshop
feed.content: It was a great learning experience. I had no knowledge about the World of Stock markets, but after attending the workshop, I was able to understand the stock market jargons and also earned a profit of over 30000 at NSE Paathshala. I loved the concept of My Captain and would recommend to everyone who is passionate about finance and stock market.

entrepreneurship.name: ENTREPRENEURSHIP
entrepreneurship.content: Discover the secret sauces of startups and train yourself to be a student Entrepreneur with this 30 day program. Get mentored by young successful Entrepreneurs.
whattolearn: Discover your personality and understand your role in your startup!
Brainstorm on an idea for your startup
Apply the Lean Canvas Model to your Startup
Come up with your Business Model
Build the first version of your product or service
How and When to raise Funding from Investors

course.name: The Big Idea
content: An introduction to the startup world.
These startups have changed our lives
What makes steve jobs’ ideas so great - The Golden circle.

course.name: Coming up with a solution
content: The secret to building a successful startup
How to setup your startup
The sexy part of startups - Marketing

course.name: The Big Picture
content: Explain your startup in One page!
Reducing the risks in running your startup
The secret to building successful products
Getting funded : What, when and how?

course.name: Raising funds as Student Entrepreneurs
content: For Entrepreneurs, Life’s a pitch!
The boring but necessary part of Startups : Registering your Company
The World of the future.

captains.name: SAMEER RAMESH
captains.content: I'm the Co-founder and CPO at The Climber, and am passionate about new products and innovations. I have a keen interest in technology platforms and network effects. I'm also a TEDx speaker and an HPAIR delegate.

captains.name: MOHAMMED ZEESHAN
captains.content: I'm a Social Entrepreneur and Co-Founder and CEO of The Climber. My journey began almost half a decade ago, when I first decided to take the startup plunge. I am a GSEP scholar, 4 times Tedx Speaker and I consult NGOs on sustainability. So far I have mentored over 300 students in Entrepreneurship, some of whom have gone ahead to win B-plan  competitions, while others have started up and have well working businesses right now!

feed.name: Chaitra Chittu , Entrepreneurship Workshop
feed.content: I took the MyCaptain Entrepreneurship Workshop in late 2017. It was quite an amazing experience to be guided by my Captain, Sameer Ramesh. I got to learn about how real businesses and startups are actually run and the best part - I got to interact with like minded people. Since then I have even started my own Food Company and Captain Sameer still guides me! In short it was an amazing experience and made me do what I love and follow my passion in Entrepreneurship!

feed.name: Deepanshu Bhanot , Entrepreneurship Workshop
feed.content: My mentor was Mohammed Zeeshan. He was amazing in his approach towards making all the mentees understand the basics of Entrepreneurship and incited us to ask questions in a manner that helped us clear all our doubts. I started up my Graphic design firm after the Workshop!

digitalmarketing.content: In this 30 day Online Workshop, learn to use all the Digital Marketing platforms and how to make money Online!
whattolearn: Wireframe and run your first Facebook and Instagram Ads
Optimise your Facebook and Instagram Ad
How to run an Email Drip Campaign
An introduction to Google Adwords and Keyword Search Ads
A practical approach to Keyword Search Ads
Importance of Content Writing and SEO
Career Prospects and Opportunities in Digital Marketing

course.name: Getting started with Digital Marketing
content: Introduction to Online Marketing
How to build an Audience on your Facebook & Instagram pages?
Setting up your first Ad Campaign on Facebook & Instagram.

course.name: Marketing Strategies and Advertising : Getting it right
content: How to get the best results out of your Ad Campaign?
Oldest trick in the book : Email Marketing.
How to set up an effective email drip campaign?

course.name: TLearning basic analytics to optimise your ads
content: Introduction to different types of Google Adwords
How to use the Adwords Tool?
A look into Marketing and Sales for StartUps.

course.name: SEO and Youtube Marketing
content: Planning and researching your first Keyword search Campaign
Should you advertise on youtube?
Content Marketing 101 - Setting up a wordpress blog
An introduction to Search Engine Optimisation

captains.name: RUHAN MADNI NAQASH
captains.content: I'm a first generation Entrepreneur, and the Co Founder and CMO of The Climber. I have been mentoring some student run startups at an individual level for 1.5 years now and help them out in terms of Business Models, Sales Channels, Customer acquisition, Marketing etc. I have been leading the Marketing team of The Climber for the past 2 years now.

feed.name: Himanshi Yadav , Advertising & Marketing Workshop
feed.content: I did my workshop on Advertising and marketing, it’s a great start to pursue something of your interest. The sessions were knowledgeable, interesting and inclusive. Special mention to Bhavana ( our captain) who is pretty helpful and goes out of her way to clear your doubts.

feed.name: Jigesh , Advertising & Marketing Workshop
feed.content: Mycaptain workshop was very useful as it helped me to enhance my knowledge on marketing and different advertising techniques. My mentor Bhavana madam, helped me a lot by clarifying all the doubts and always motivated me to look deep into the marketing world. It was a great experience altogether.

novelwriting.name: NOVEL WRITING
novelwriting.content: Get inspired to create your own Characters and Plot, and learn about getting Published in this Comprehensive 30 day Workshop, all under the guidance of a young author!
whattolearn: How to bring perspective into your Novel?
How to perfect your plot, setting and theme

course.name: Getting started with Novel Writing
content: Do you know why you write?
Let’s breakdown types and genres
Advice for first time authors
The secrets behind a great novel

course.name: Setting, Storyline and Theme
content: How to build an Engaging plot?
What makes a perfect setting?
How to build a powerful theme for your story?
How can characters come to life?

course.name: A gist of your Novel
content: How to bring perspective into your Novel?
How to write realistic dialogues?
Tips to help you finish that first draft
Things to do to reach your final draft
How to make your writing interesting?

course.name: Editing and Publishing
content: Should you self publish your first novel?
Life as a young author
The secret to getting onto a best sellers list

captains.name: KAVYA SHARMA
captains.content: Kavya Sharma, a Masters in Creative Writing from the University Of Nottingham, England is a published author of the book “To Naddiyya” and a poetry collection- “The Carmine Memories: An Insane Woman’s Poetry” published by Partridge India.Her poetry has also been featured in the anthology ‘Ninety Seven Poems’ by Terribly Tiny Tales (published by Penguin) and Map Called Home by Kitaab.Org, Singapore.  Her work has been published on various platforms including The Bangalore Review, Thought Catalog, Terribly Tiny Tales, Out of Print Magazine, Indus Woman Writing, Spark Magazine, Youth Ki Awaaz, etc. Currently, Kavya works as a Commissioning Editor at Half Baked Beans Publishing House, Delhi and also runs her own literary magazine by the name Verse of Silence which comes out every month both digitally and in print.

captains.name: MEGHA RAO
captains.content: Megha is a poet and an artist, represented by Red Ink Literary Agency, New Delhi. Two of her fiction titles have been published by Penguin Random House in 2015 and 2016, and her poetry has been featured in a multitude of Online magazines like The Open Road Review and New Asian Writing. She is also the compiler and editor of the anthology of poems by Half Baked Beans, a growing literary platform for aspiring writers. She has done her masters in English literature from the University of Nottingham, England, and has also interned with HarperCollins. Currently Megha works as the Content lead for the Terribly Tiny Tales App.

captains.name: DAMINI KANE
captains.content: Damini Kane is the author of The Sunlight Plane, which is also her debut novel. She also writes short fiction, and was longlisted for the DNA Out of Print Short Fiction contest in 2016, for her piece, Aleppo. She is also one of the selected winners of Campus Diaries, 25 under 25, under the Writing category. Her favourite genres to write are fantasy and adventure and is known for her sharp focus on a characters’ emotional development. Damini loves to mentor young writers and instills an unparalleled passion in them.

feed.name: Labeeb Ajmal , Creative Writing Workshop
feed.content: The Creative Writing Workshop conducted by MyCaptain was a great one to hone my writing skills. It gave me insight on how to structure my poetry and make it more presentable. The Captain was amazing and a fun relationship was share on and off the workshop. This is a great way to learn more about one's passion with tutors/mentors who strike a chord with those who join the workshops.

feed.name: Madhura Sonegaonkar , Creative Writing Workshop
feed.content: My experience with my captain was extraordinary. The mentor was very helpful and interactive. My writing improved very much due to the workshop and I went from last page scribbling to being a published poet for platforms like ttt (terribly tiny tales) and other platforms Special shout out to my mentor who still helps me every time I call him.
